description.value: A `calcite-dropdown` can be used to provide an absolutely positioned set of selectable items. You can combine multiple groups of items and selection modes, and optionally pass a title for each group. Every `calcite-dropdown-item` must have a parent `calcite-dropdown-group`, even if the `groupTitle` property is not set.

attributes.name: close-on-select-disabled
attributes.description:
When `true`, the component will remain open after a selection is made.

If the `selectionMode` of the selected `calcite-dropdown-item`'s containing `calcite-dropdown-group` is `"none"`, the component will always close.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: When `true`, interaction is prevented and the component is displayed with lower opacity.

attributes.name: max-items
attributes.description:
Specifies the maximum number of `calcite-dropdown-item`s to display before showing a scroller.
Value must be greater than `0`, and does not include `groupTitle`'s from `calcite-dropdown-group`.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: When `true`, displays and positions the component.

attributes.name: overlay-positioning
attributes.description:
Determines the type of positioning to use for the overlaid content.

Using `"absolute"` will work for most cases. The component will be positioned inside of overflowing parent containers and will affect the container's layout.

`"fixed"` should be used to escape an overflowing parent container, or when the reference element's `position` CSS property is `"fixed"`.

`"single"` allows and requires one selected `calcite-dropdown-item`, and
`"none"` does not allow selection on `calcite-dropdown-item`s.

description.value: The `calcite-shell-panel` is a child component of `calcite-shell` used as a container to display other components like `calcite-block` and `calcite-flow`.

description.value: The calcite-split-button control is one that combines a button with a dropdown menu in order to provide a primary action along with one or more related secondary options / actions. It's useful for grouping related actions or options for users, while elevating a commonly-used or default action for easier access. Its inner content populates the control's dropdown menu, and is thus expected to be valid `calcite-dropdown` content.

attributes.name: overlay-positioning
attributes.description:
Determines the type of positioning to use for the overlaid content.

Using `"absolute"` will work for most cases. The component will be positioned inside of overflowing parent containers and will affect the container's layout.

`"fixed"` should be used to escape an overflowing parent container, or when the reference element's `position` CSS property is `"fixed"`.

attributes.name: overlay-positioning
attributes.description:
Determines the type of positioning to use for the overlaid content.

Using `"absolute"` will work for most cases. The component will be positioned inside of overflowing parent containers and will affect the container's layout.

The `"fixed"` value should be used to escape an overflowing parent container, or when the reference element's `position` CSS property is `"fixed"`.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description: Determines where the component will be positioned relative to the `referenceElement`.

attributes.name: reference-element
attributes.description:
The `referenceElement` to position the component according to its `"placement"` value.

Setting to the `HTMLElement` is preferred so the component does not need to query the DOM for the `referenceElement`.

However, a string ID of the reference element can be used.

description.value: `calcite-value-list` is housed in a panel and contains `calcite-value-list-item`s. The value list has options for drag and drop, label editing, and single or multi-select of items which can be done through shift+click.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: When `true`, interaction is prevented and the component is displayed with lower opacity.

attributes.name: drag-enabled
attributes.description: When `true`, `calcite-value-list-item`s are sortable via a draggable button.

attributes.name: filter-enabled
attributes.description: When `true`, an input appears at the top of the component that can be used by end users to filter list items.

attributes.name: filter-placeholder
attributes.description: Placeholder text for the filter's input field.

attributes.name: filter-text
attributes.description: Text for the filter input field.

attributes.name: group
attributes.description:
The component's group identifier.

To drag elements from one list into another, both lists must have the same group value.

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: When `true`, a busy indicator is displayed.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description:
Similar to standard radio buttons and checkboxes.
When `true`, a user can select multiple `calcite-value-list-item`s at a time.
When `false`, only a single `calcite-value-list-item` can be selected at a time,
and a new selection will deselect previous selections.

attributes.name: selection-follows-focus
attributes.description: When `true` and single-selection is enabled, the selection changes when navigating `calcite-value-list-item`s via keyboard.

description.value: `calcite-value-list-item`s are cards contained in a `calcite-value-list`. They each can have a label and description, an icon and can have their label's be editable (inherited from `calcite-value-list`). The developer can disable or preselect each list item and give it a value.

attributes.name: description

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: When `true`, interaction is prevented and the component is displayed with lower opacity.

attributes.description: Determines the icon SVG symbol that will be shown. Options are circle, square, grip or null.

attributes.name: icon-flip-rtl
attributes.description: When `true`, the icon will be flipped when the element direction is right-to-left (`"rtl"`).

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Label and accessible name for the component. Appears next to the icon.

attributes.description: When `true`, prevents the content of the component from user interaction.

attributes.description: When `true`, adds an action to remove the component.

attributes.description: When `true`, the component is selected.
